Bank Mau Turunkan Bunga Kredit yang Disentil Jokowi, Asal...
06 Nov 2019, 08:22 by Danang Sugianto


Ilustrasi/Foto: Rachman Haryanto

Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) melontarkan sindiran keras kepada perbankan nasional. Dia menyinggung kondisi suku bunga kredit perbankan yang tak kunjung turun meskipun suku bunga acuan dari Bank Indonesia (BI) sudah turun berkali-kali.Beberapa bank pun menjawab sindiran itu. PT Bank Negara Indonesia (Persero) Tbk (BNI) misalnya yang mengaku tak berani menurunkan suku bunga jika biaya dana atau cost of fund masih tinggi."Yang penting cost of fund-nya turun, baru berani turun. Kalau cost of fund belum turun ya enggak berani lah. Nanti kalau kita semakin kecil dimarahi investor," kata Direktur Keuangan BNI Ario Bimo di Hotel Fairmont, Jakarta Selatan, Rabu (6/11/2019).Intinya, kata Bimo, BNI mendengarkan permintaan Presiden Jokowi. Namun keinginan itu tak bisa langsung direalisasikan jika cost of fund belum turun."Kita sekarang lagi turun dulu pelan-pelan kan kemarin 3,2%. Kita lihat pelan-pelan, kalau cost of fund turun kita baru berani nurunin," tambahnya.Sementara di lokasi yang sama, Direktur Keuangan dan Strategi Bank Mandiri Panji Irawan juga menjawab hal senada. Meski Bank Mandiri mengaku masih ada ruang untuk menurunkan suku bunga tapi biaya dana dan persaingan pasar juga menjadi pertimbangan."Ada sih (ruang penurunan bunga kredit), karena kami juga nurunin cost of fund juga pasti terus melihat persaingan di pasar juga. Pasti dua-duanya bagian dari industri juga. Jadi dalam kaitan itu pastilah kami respons, nggak mungkin nggak respons," tuturnya.Panji menerangkan, jika biaya dana turun maka risiko bank juga akan akan turun. Jika risiko turun maka perbankan tidak akan khawatir untuk menurunkan suku bunga.Sekadar informasi, selain menyindir bank yang belum menurunkan suku bunga kredit, Jokowi juga menyindir bank yang masih nyaman memberikan pembiayaan kepada nasabah besar saja dan melupakan nasabah kecil yang seharusnya banyak dibantu.Hal itu diungkapkannya di depan para bankir saat membuka acara Indonesia Banking Expo 2019 di Hotel Fairmont, Jakarta Selatan."Saya mengajak bapak ibu semuanya jangan hanya membiayai yang besar-besar saja," kata Jokowi. Banks Want to Reduce Credit Interest with Jokowi, as long as ...
Nov 6 2019, 08:22 by Danang Sugianto


Illustration / Photo: Rachman Haryanto

Jakarta - President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) made a strong insinuation to the national banks. He alluded to the condition of bank lending rates that have not gone down even though the benchmark interest rate of Bank Indonesia (BI) has fallen many times. Some banks also answered the insinuation. PT Bank Negara Indonesia (Persero) Tbk (BNI), for example, claimed that it did not dare to reduce interest rates if the cost of funds or the cost of funds was still high. "The important thing is that the cost of funds has decreased, then they have dared to go down. "I don't want to be brave. Later, if we get smaller and scolded by investors," said BNI Finance Director Ario Bimo at the Fairmont Hotel, South Jakarta, Wednesday (11/06/2019). In essence, said Bimo, BNI listened to President Jokowi's request. But that desire cannot be realized right away if the cost of funds has not yet fallen. "We are now going down again slowly, right yesterday, 3.2%. We will see slowly, if the cost of funds goes down, we will only be able to reduce it," he added. in the same location, Bank Mandiri Director of Finance and Strategy Panji Irawan also responded similarly. Although Bank Mandiri acknowledges that there is still room to reduce interest rates, the cost of funds and market competition is also a consideration. "There is still a (reduction in credit interest rates), because we also lower the cost of funds, and we will continue to see competition in the market as well. both are part of the industry as well. So in that connection, we certainly respond, there is no way that it will not respond, "he said. If the risk goes down, banks will not worry about lowering interest rates. Just for information, aside from insinuating banks that have not lowered loan interest rates, Jokowi also insinuates banks that are still comfortable providing financing to large customers and forget about small customers who should be helped a lot. he revealed in front of the bankers when he opened the Indonesia Banking Expo 2019 at the Fairmont Hotel, South Jakarta. "I invite all ladies and gentlemen not to finance only the big ones," Jokowi said.
